job_title: Associate Scientist/Scientist, Health Care Analytical – Monograph Reform and Measurement Science
job_text: ['', 'A strong record of innovation working with R&D partners and lab personnel to understand key needs and providing/implementing solutions to complex problems; capable of providing monograph reform/measurement science leadership for the team and designing/implementing an action plan to deliver robust solutions.', 'Effective oral/written communication skills are needed, including the ability to document/share critical insights/observations/results, and provide clear/concise technical summaries via written reports. Excellent record keeping and note-booking skills are also required.', 'Have a history of driving projects to success through proactive leadership. Be comfortable with taking ownership/initiative and independence, leading by example, operating with discipline and working with a sense of urgency.', 'Mastery in Analytical chemistry, reflected by a BS or MS in chemistry or at least five years’ experience in a closely related field. Experience/Training in Technical Writing is highly desired. Technical curiosity and a passion to continually learn and develop mastery across OTC regulated products and analytical methods/techniques is required.', 'Whatweoffer', 'A strong commitment to genuine learning and good science is necessary. Operate with a high level of attention to detail and technical rigor across Health Care Analytical. Have the ability to work on multiple projects/deliverables at any given time and be able to adapt to changing priorities while consistently delivering against commitments with excellence. Experience in cGMPs and test method validation/stability requirements for FDA regulated products is a plus.', 'Mastery in Analytical chemistry, reflected by a BS or MS in chemistry or at least five years’ experience in a closely related field. Excellent record keeping and note-booking skills are also required.Have a history of driving projects to success through proactive leadership. Be comfortable with taking ownership/initiative and independence, leading by example, operating with discipline and working with a sense of urgency.A strong commitment to genuine learning and good science is necessary. job_title: BS/MS Research Scientist, Biological Chemistry, Oncology
job_text: ['', 'BA/BS or MS degree in Biochemistry, Biophysics, Enzymology or a related field with 10+ (BA/BS) or 5+ (MS) years of relevant laboratory research experience through employment, internships or co-operative study programs', 'Provide biochemical and biophysical expertise to project teams at various stages of the drug discovery process through the development and execution of assays to identify and characterize small molecule modulators of cancer targetsUtilize mechanistic enzymology, enzyme kinetics, binding affinity/kinetics, and thermodynamics to understand the mechanism of action of novel therapeuticsImplement emerging cutting edge technologies and novel assay approaches to advance drug discovery programsContribute to medicinal chemistry drug discovery efforts to evaluate compound SAR and mode of action characterizationMentor and train junior scientistsCommunicate, collaborate and challenge assumptions to push scientific boundaries with a diverse team of cross-functional scientists', 'Minimum Requirements', 'The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.', 'Proven ability to analyze, interpret and present data in a clear and concise manner', 'Excellent team-player, with strong communication and inter-personal skills', 'Job Description', 'Functional Area', 'Mentor and train junior scientists', 'Shift Work', 'Expertise in fluorescence-based assay techniques (HTRF, FP, or quench assays), label-free technologies (SPR, ITC, DSF, AUC, or mass spectrometry), and/or protein expression, purification, and characterization (e.g. DLS, SEC-MALS, FFF, DSC, CD)', 'Hands-on experience with automation to enable medium to high throughput assays is a plus', 'Country', 'Company/Legal Entity', 'BA/BS or MS degree in Biochemistry, Biophysics, Enzymology or a related field with 10+ (BA/BS) or 5+ (MS) years of relevant laboratory research experience through employment, internships or co-operative study programsSolid understanding of enzyme kinetics, protein structure/function relationships and activity regulation, and mechanism of inhibition/binding studiesExperience with biochemical and biophysical assay development for hit finding, validation and characterization. Hands-on experience studying enzyme function, protein-protein interactions, DNA/RNA binding proteins, multi-protein complexes, protein oligomerization state and/or covalent inhibitorsExpertise in fluorescence-based assay techniques (HTRF, FP, or quench assays), label-free technologies (SPR, ITC, DSF, AUC, or mass spectrometry), and/or protein expression, purification, and characterization (e.g. DLS, SEC-MALS, FFF, DSC, CD)Hands-on experience with automation to enable medium to high throughput assays is a plusProven ability to analyze, interpret and present data in a clear and concise mannerExcellent team-player, with strong communication and inter-personal skills', 'Employment Type', 'Contribute to medicinal chemistry drug discovery efforts to evaluate compound SAR and mode of action characterization', 'Work Location', 'Division', 'Business Unit', 'EEO Statement', 'Job Type', 'Communicate, collaborate and challenge assumptions to push scientific boundaries with a diverse team of cross-functional scientists', 'Experience with biochemical and biophysical assay development for hit finding, validation and characterization. Hands-on experience studying enzyme function, protein-protein interactions, DNA/RNA binding proteins, multi-protein complexes, protein oligomerization state and/or covalent inhibitors', 'Provide biochemical and biophysical expertise to project teams at various stages of the drug discovery process through the development and execution of assays to identify and characterize small molecule modulators of cancer targets', 'Implement emerging cutting edge technologies and novel assay approaches to advance drug discovery programs', 'Solid understanding of enzyme kinetics, protein structure/function relationships and activity regulation, and mechanism of inhibition/binding studies', 'Utilize mechanistic enzymology, enzyme kinetics, binding affinity/kinetics, and thermodynamics to understand the mechanism of action of novel therapeutics']

job_title: Associate Scientist/Scientist, Health Care Analytical - Lab Computing and Measurement Science
job_text: ['', 'Mastery in lab computing as related to analytical chemistry; working knowledge of analytical chemistry; flexibility; leadership; project management; collaboration/ communication skills; a focus on results; a sense of urgency; and strong critical thinking. Some experience in coding, system design, working with outside digital innovation providers, and optimizing systems are valuable, along with knowledge of systems validation. Strong technical laboratory skills, attention to detail and technical curiosity are all highly desired.', 'Proven track record of cross functional collaboration is a must. The successful candidate will need to form productive, collaborative relationships with partners across various R&D functions to lead/execute HC digital innovation and OC project deliverables. The individual will leverage his/her internal and external networks to help drive innovation, enable problem solving and reapply best practices.', 'Effective oral/written communication skills are needed, including the ability to document/share critical insights/observations/results, provide clear/concise technical updates/presentations to those not familiar with the technologies that Analytical uses and the ability to pull together deployment, training, and communication plans related to digital innovation programs. Excellent record keeping and note-booking skills are also required.', 'Mastery in both digital innovation and analytical chemistry. Technical curiosity and a desire to continually learn and develop mastery across digital innovation and analytical methods/techniques is required.Proven track record of cross functional collaboration is a must. The successful candidate will need to form productive, collaborative relationships with partners across various R&D functions to lead/execute HC digital innovation and OC project deliverables. The individual will leverage his/her internal and external networks to help drive innovation, enable problem solving and reapply best practices.A strong record of innovation working with R&D partners and lab personnel to understand key needs and providing/implementing solutions to complex problems; capable of providing digital innovation/measurement science leadership for the team and designing/implementing an action plan to deliver robust solutions.Effective oral/written communication skills are needed, including the ability to document/share critical insights/observations/results, provide clear/concise technical updates/presentations to those not familiar with the technologies that Analytical uses and the ability to pull together deployment, training, and communication plans related to digital innovation programs. Excellent record keeping and note-booking skills are also required.A history of driving projects to success through proactive leadership. The candidate should be comfortable with taking ownership/initiative and independence, leading by example, operating with discipline and working with a sense of urgency.A strong commitment to genuine learning and good science is necessary. This role requires the individual to operate with a high level of attention to detail and technical rigor across Health Care Analytical. The individual should have the ability to work on multiple projects/deliverables at any given time and be able to adapt to changing priorities while consistently delivering against commitments with excellence. Experience in cGMPs and test method validation/stability requirements for FDA regulated products is a plus but not required.Mastery in lab computing as related to analytical chemistry; working knowledge of analytical chemistry; flexibility; leadership; project management; collaboration/ communication skills; a focus on results; a sense of urgency; and strong critical thinking. Some experience in coding, system design, working with outside digital innovation providers, and optimizing systems are valuable, along with knowledge of systems validation. Strong technical laboratory skills, attention to detail and technical curiosity are all highly desired.', 'Whatweoffer', 'A history of driving projects to success through proactive leadership. The candidate should be comfortable with taking ownership/initiative and independence, leading by example, operating with discipline and working with a sense of urgency.', 'A strong record of innovation working with R&D partners and lab personnel to understand key needs and providing/implementing solutions to complex problems; capable of providing digital innovation/measurement science leadership for the team and designing/implementing an action plan to deliver robust solutions.', 'Skills you can expect to learn/build in this job:', 'A strong commitment to genuine learning and good science is necessary. This role requires the individual to operate with a high level of attention to detail and technical rigor across Health Care Analytical. The individual should have the ability to work on multiple projects/deliverables at any given time and be able to adapt to changing priorities while consistently delivering against commitments with excellence. Experience in cGMPs and test method validation/stability requirements for FDA regulated products is a plus but not required.', 'Description', 'Mastery in both digital innovation and analytical chemistry. Technical curiosity and a desire to continually learn and develop mastery across digital innovation and analytical methods/techniques is required.', 'About Us', 'Qualifications']

['Position: UX Researcher Location: Fully Remote/Off-site Status: Freelance Estimated Duration: 6 months  Starts: October 2020 Rate: DOE    Job Description: Our client, a pharmaceutical and tech company for humans and animals is seeking a UX Researcher based in the mid-west to conduct UX research for a new mobile app they are developing!  This is a remote role, but 30-40% will be traveling in the midwest to do UX researcher with app users aka farmers and livestock managers  The ideal UX Researcher will: -Conduct user feedback sessions, analysis and synthesis of research data - Understanding user centric design approaches and applying those to the development of the app  - Creating surveys and tests to get data on user flow and user interactions - Work with global team ranging from UX Designers, to Data Scientists and Product Owners - Interview users one on one to get feedback  The ideal UX Researcher must:  - Have 5+ years of UX Research experience (design skills are also a plus)  - Be comfortable traveling to rural farms across the US and occasionally being around animals (pigs) and livestock - Have experience working with large digital teams from data scientists to UX designers - Have experience consulting with key stake holders to prioritize user centric design approaches and methodologies']

job_title: Three positions: Postdoc / researcher in bioinformatics and computational genomics
job_text: ['', '1.\xa0Postdoc in Single-cell Computational Genomics:\xa0This position is funded by a $9M award in Parkinson’s disease. We will perform single nucleus RNA-seq and ATAC-seq, and a new method in spatial transcriptomics to understand how GWAS variants cause specific brain cells to die (e.g. Dong et al., Nature Neuroscience, 2018). We prefer someone with single-cell genomics data analysis experience. Skills in high-dimensional data visualization is a plus. The postdoc will be jointly supervised by Xianjun Dong, Ph.D. and Clemens Scherzer, MD.', '2.\xa0Postdoc in Bioinformatics and Biostatistics:\xa0This position is funded by an NIH U01 grant. We will analyze the genotyping, RNA-seq, and clinical data from a large cohort of Parkinson’s disease, to model the prediction of disease onset and progression (e.g. Liu et al., Lancet Neurology, 2017). We will need someone familiar with statistical modeling and machine learning.\xa0\xa0Experience in applying advanced AI methods (e.g. variational autoencoder) to omics data is a plus. The postdoc will be jointly supervised by Xianjun Dong, Ph.D. and Clemens Scherzer, MD.', '3.\xa0\xa0Research Scientist in Bioinformatics:\xa0This is a staff position with a competitive salary and expectation to provide bioinformatics service to the faculty in the HMS and Brigham community. As a full-time employee in the new Genomics and Bioinformatics Hub (http://bioinformatics.bwh.harvard.edu), the candidate will work with the director to develop bioinformatics pipelines for NGS data (e.g. bulk tissue and single-cell RNAseq, ATAC-seq, WGS, WES, or ChIP-seq, etc.), provide both standard and customized data analysis service and bioinformatics training to the clients. Experience in processing raw FASTQ files is required. Ability to generate high-quality reports, communicate with clients effectively, good time management are key characteristics for an ideal candidate.\xa0', 'Do you want to use your computational skills to solve brain disease?', 'Postdoc in Bioinformatics and Biostatistics:\xa0', 'Learn more about us', 'Do you want to use your computational skills to solve brain disease?\xa0At the Department of Neurology at Harvard Medical School and Brigham & Women’s Hospital, we have three vacant positions as either postdoctoral fellow or research scientist in bioinformatics. The vacancies are well supported by awarded grants. The candidate will work in an interdisciplinary environment together with world-class scientists in bioinformatics, neurology, and basic neuroscience.', 'Apply. Please submit (1) your CV, (2) a cover letter outlining your motivation and goals, and (3) contact information for three references to Drs. Xianjun Dong (xdong@rics.bwh.harvard.edu) and Clemens Scherzer (cscherzer@rics.bwh.harvard.edu), and cc to our administrative assistant Marilyn Sullivan at msullivan70@bwh.harvard.edu.', 'Research Scientist in Bioinformatics:', 'Other requirements of the qualification', 'Apply', 'Postdoc in Single-cell Computational Genomics:\xa0', 'Learn more about us: Neurogenomics Laboratory (www.scherzerlaboratory.org), Center for Advanced Parkinson Research (www.bwhparkinsoncenter.org), Genomics and Bioinformatics Hub (http://bioinformatics.bwh.harvard.edu)', 'Other requirements of the qualification. We want you to have (1) one prior original article as the first author; (2) a Ph. D. or equivalent doctoral degree (preferably in bioinformatics, computer science, or statistical genetics); (3) research experience in bioinformatics and analyses of genome-wide data (for example, RNA sequencing, whole-genome sequencing, GWAS, eQTL, AI methods); (4) strong quantitative skills preferably in computer science, bioinformatics, or statistics are necessary; (5) programming background is necessary (e.g. R, Python, bash); (6) excellent written and spoken English. Candidates dedicated to succeeding in an academic research career are preferred and such career paths are available.']

['Enterprise Data Engineer ', 'A passion for working with data and developing software to address data processing challenges Proficiency with Python, C++, Java or equivalent Proficiency with RDBMS, NoSQL, distributed compute platforms such as Spark, Dask or Hadoop Prior experience building data pipelines from structured or unstructured data preferably including web crawlers Prior work developing BI tooling and/or application development for data analytics Advanced technical communication skills Working knowledge of statistics, predictive analytics or machine learning techniques Strong business acumen with prior experience in investment research or direct exposure to product or data science teams AND passionate about using data for investment decisions', 'Advanced technical communication skills ', 'Prior experience building data pipelines from structured or unstructured data preferably including web crawlers ', 'Enterprise Data Engineers build pipelines that support datasets used by all investment teams and strategies across the firm. They manage the firm’s most critical data sets and focus on applying software development best practices to solve complex data challenges. The expectation is that the data engineer has sound programming skills, strong business acumen, and a strong interest in finance. ', 'New York, NY', 'Take on an entrepreneurial mentality by building and selling your own ideas. We work in an evolving space and we expect you to help design our evolution by challenging the status quo and independently identifying opportunities to improve the entire data organization. ', 'Required Skills', 'Prior work developing BI tooling and/or application development for data analytics ', 'Working knowledge of statistics, predictive analytics or machine learning techniques ', 'A passion for working with data and developing software to address data processing challenges ', 'Enterprise Data Engineer', 'Key Responsibilities', 'New York, NY ', 'Strong business acumen with prior experience in investment research or direct exposure to product or data science teams AND passionate about using data for investment decisions', 'Key Responsibilities ', '\xa0 ', 'Build tooling and automation around data pipelines that improve the efficiency, quality and resiliency of our data platform ', 'Partner with internal analysts, quants and data scientists to design, develop, test and deploy solutions that answer fundamental questions about financial markets. ', 'Develop solutions that enable internal analysts to efficiently extract insights from data. This includes owning the ingestion (web scrapes, S3/FTP sync, bespoke processes), transformations (Python, Perl) and interface (API, schema design, events, etc.) ', 'Develop solutions that enable internal analysts to efficiently extract insights from data. This includes owning the ingestion (web scrapes, S3/FTP sync, bespoke processes), transformations (Python, Perl) and interface (API, schema design, events, etc.) Build tooling and automation around data pipelines that improve the efficiency, quality and resiliency of our data platform Partner with internal analysts, quants and data scientists to design, develop, test and deploy solutions that answer fundamental questions about financial markets. Take on an entrepreneurial mentality by building and selling your own ideas. We work in an evolving space and we expect you to help design our evolution by challenging the status quo and independently identifying opportunities to improve the entire data organization. ', 'Required Skills ', 'Proficiency with Python, C++, Java or equivalent ', 'Data Engineers are the architects of the next generation platforms that control how the firm interacts with and consumes information. They own the entire data pipeline starting with how we ingest data from the outside world, through the transformation of data into actionable insights, and finally the interfaces and APIs that our analysts and portfolio managers use to monetize that information. Throughout that process our data engineers work closely with investment professionals and researchers to design systems that answer some of the most challenging questions in the hedge fund industry. ', 'Proficiency with RDBMS, NoSQL, distributed compute platforms such as Spark, Dask or Hadoop ']

job_title: BS/MS Research Scientist – Innovative Lentiviral Gene Therapies
job_text: ['', ' Together with a small team, establish and drive NBC’s lentiviral vector core for production of a variety of LV pseudotypes at research scale for CAR-T therapies and beyond.', ' Experience with working with human primary cells and chimeric antigen receptors (CAR-T).', ' Identify unmet needs and collaborate for novel solutions', 'Minimum Requirements', 'The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.', ' Bridge protein engineering expertise, conjugation and capsid engineering to bring the next generation of cell specific gene delivery platforms into the pipeline.', ' Expertise in LV therapeutic design, production and characterization and delivery is needed.', ' Integration into a team of highly talented scientists responsible to drive lentiviral innovation to patients. Together with a small team, establish and drive NBC’s lentiviral vector core for production of a variety of LV pseudotypes at research scale for CAR-T therapies and beyond. Evaluation and implementation of approaches for regulatable gene expression/knockdown, optimized tissue-specific promotors and redirected lentiviral tropism. Bridge protein engineering expertise, conjugation and capsid engineering to bring the next generation of cell specific gene delivery platforms into the pipeline. Functional characterization of novel constructs via in vitro cellular assays for selectivity and activity. Interface within the team to bring novel designs and applications to our partners. Offer innovative approaches to scientific questions and troubleshooting efforts Identify unmet needs and collaborate for novel solutions', 'Biotherapeutic And Analytical Technologies - Nibr', ' BS/MS with more than 3 years confirmed experience in lentiviral-mediated gene delivery. Experience with working with human primary cells and chimeric antigen receptors (CAR-T).', 'Job Description', 'Functional Area', ' Integration into a team of highly talented scientists responsible to drive lentiviral innovation to patients.', ' Knowledge in application of lentiviruses to CAR-T therapy.', 'Shift Work', ' Offer innovative approaches to scientific questions and troubleshooting efforts', 'Country', ' Highly collaborative spirit inside and outside of department to advance programs; good communication skills, creativity, and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment', 'Company/Legal Entity', ' BS/MS with more than 3 years confirmed experience in lentiviral-mediated gene delivery.', 'Employment Type', ' Functional characterization of novel constructs via in vitro cellular assays for selectivity and activity.', 'Work Location', 'Division', ' Interface within the team to bring novel designs and applications to our partners.', 'Business Unit', 'EEO Statement', 'Job Type', ' Prior experience with AAV mediated gene therapy would be a plus.', ' Evaluation and implementation of approaches for regulatable gene expression/knockdown, optimized tissue-specific promotors and redirected lentiviral tropism.', ' Expertise in LV therapeutic design, production and characterization and delivery is needed. Prior experience with AAV mediated gene therapy would be a plus. Knowledge in molecular biology, protein engineering, capsid and envelope engineering approaches to optimize expression, function and specificity of the transgene. Highly collaborative spirit inside and outside of department to advance programs; good communication skills, creativity, and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment Knowledge in application of lentiviruses to CAR-T therapy.', ' Knowledge in molecular biology, protein engineering, capsid and envelope engineering approaches to optimize expression, function and specificity of the transgene.']

['', '• Analyze accuracy and stability of numerical algorithms and linear algebra solvers.', '• Ph.D. in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or Physical Sciences/Engineering within the last 3 years, with a strong research background in at least some of applied mathematics, computational methods, and scientific computing.', '• Experience developing mathematical and software models for science applications is desired.', 'What is Required:', 'Apply directly online at http://50.73.55.13/counter.php?id=187782 and follow the on-line instructions to complete the application process.\xa0', '• General experience in developing and using numerical software for partial differential equations.', 'Equal Employment Opportunity: Berkeley Lab is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or protected veteran status. Berkeley Lab is in compliance with the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision under 41 CFR 60-1.4. Click here (https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters) to view the poster and supplement: "Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law."', 'We are seeking strong software and applied math candidates that can help develop the next generation of finite volume numerical algorithms, which must be both highly accurate and fast on multi-core and GPU architectures. You will join an interdisciplinary team of applied mathematicians and software engineers to develop new algorithms for next-generation high performance computing (HPC) computational science simulations.', '• Contribute to publications and participate in conferences and meetings.', 'Notes:', 'Organization:\xa0CR-Computational Research', 'Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory encourages applications from women, minorities, veterans, and other underrepresented groups presently considering scientific research careers.', 'What You Will Do:', 'We value and strive for diversity in backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.', 'HPC Numerical Algorithms Postdoctoral Researcher - 91276', '• Some experience in C/C++ programming.', '• This position may be subject to a background check. Any convictions will be evaluated to determine if they directly relate to the responsibilities and requirements of the position. Having a conviction history will not automatically disqualify an applicant from being considered for employment.', '• Understanding of computer systems architecture and their contributions to the overall system performance is also desirable.\xa0', 'How To Apply', '• Contribute in a multidisciplinary team environment which includes mathematicians, software developers, and computational scientists.', 'Berkeley Lab’s Computational Research (https://crd.lbl.gov/) Division has an opening for a HPC Numerical Algorithms Postdoctoral Researcher to work on high-performance numerical algorithm development. The Applied Numerical Algorithms Group (ANAG) develops advanced numerical algorithms and software for partial differential equations integrated with the application of the software to problems of independent scientific and engineering interest. The primary focus of our work is in the development of high-resolution and adaptive discretizations of partial differential equations in complex geometries, targeting DOE-mission applications including biological systems, electro-chemical and electro-magnetic systems, climate, and fusion energy.', '• Work will be primarily performed at Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, 1 Cyclotron Road, Berkeley, CA.', '• This position is represented by a union for collective bargaining purposes.', '• Understand C++ software design and development for high-performance computer architectures.', 'For full consideration, please submit a CV. The posting shall remain open until the position is filled.', '• This is a full-time 2 year, postdoctoral appointment with the possibility of renewal based upon satisfactory job performance, continuing availability of funds and ongoing operational needs. You must have less than 3 years of paid postdoctoral experience. Salary for Postdoctoral positions depends on years of experience post-degree.', '• Salary will be predetermined based on postdoctoral step rates.']

C++14/17 is beneficial ', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field from a top tier university ", 'Previous experience in the design, optimization, and support of big-data ecosystems ', "The nature of the problems we work on are really challenging, hence we hire some of the world's top talent to develop novel AI methods and trading strategies. Our team of talented researchers and technologists have been recognized as leaders in their field. We are passionate about hiring the best and the brightest, empowering them with the tools and mentorship needed to be successful. Our environment is highly collaborative and open, fostering innovation and growth. ", 'Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and database schema design ', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field from a top tier university 3+ years' experience in data engineering or related software engineering Demonstrable experience with Python and SQL.  C++14/17 is beneficial Experience with columnar time series databases such as KDB would be welcome Experience with distributed systems (Condor, Hadoop, Spark) in a Linux environment Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and database schema design Ability to troubleshoot any performance, system, or data-related issue Previous experience in the design, optimization, and support of big-data ecosystems Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with machine learning researchers, traders, and other engineers Have an interest and enthusiasm for learning about financial markets (previous experience not required) ", 'Ping pong and poker games ', 'NEW YORK ', 'Ability to troubleshoot any performance, system, or data-related issue ', 'Ping pong and poker games Team outings, such as go-karting and cooking classes Power stretching and floatation therapy Unlimited office snacks Free breakfast, lunch, and dinner Gym Membership Meditation', 'While we are serious about our work at our company, we also promote a fun startup environment!\xa0 ', 'DATA ENGINEER ', 'As a Data Engineer at our firm, you will play a critical role in managing vast amounts of data that drive our automated trading platform. ['', 'A high level of mathematical and statistical literacy, and an intense interest in applying quantitative analysis to do first class research. ', 'We are based in San Francisco, close to Caltrain and BART. We deeply value intellectual curiosity, creative idea generation, and close collaboration. We offer above market equity and cash compensation, and generous benefits including paternity and maternity leave policy. ', "We are a small team of fewer than 15 with a diversity of ideas and backgrounds applying machine learning, software engineering and rigorous scientific investigation to revamp the lending and securitization space. Every member of the team has a major impact on the company's success, and gets to see their contributions working in the real world. Building good financial forecasting models is extremely challenging from both a technology and research point of view. ", 'What you bring to the table ', 'You’ll collaborate with a group of colleagues with a variety of backgrounds in a process of scientific inquiry. ', 'By honestly and openly reviewing others’ work, and having your work reviewed by them, you’ll be a guardian of the research process at Theorem. ', 'Knowledge of finance is cool – but in no way a requirement. ', 'What you’ll do ', 'A high level of mathematical and statistical literacy, and an intense interest in applying quantitative analysis to do first class research. You should be a good scientist. \xa0You need to know when you have something and when you don’t, you cannot be fooled by randomness. You must be comfortable and enjoy working with data. \xa0This is the lifeblood of our business, your hypotheses start there and your testing ends there. You should be creative. \xa0You will be coming up with original hypotheses to expand and refine our understanding of the world, and a framework to validate them. You must be comfortable writing code. \xa0Nobody will be doing it for you. \xa0The better you are at it, the more efficiently you can explore the model space and find winning ideas. Research background devising novel approaches to solving problems and applying them to real world data to achieve robust, repeatable results. Knowledge of finance is cool – but in no way a requirement. ', 'You should be a good scientist. \xa0You need to know when you have something and when you don’t, you cannot be fooled by randomness. ', 'You should be creative. \xa0You will be coming up with original hypotheses to expand and refine our understanding of the world, and a framework to validate them. ', 'Quantitative Researcher ', 'You’ll need to care more about analysis being correct then achieving a p-value below 0.05. ', 'You’ll investigate data, construct a hypothesis, and think deeply about the results. \xa0After several iterations, you will discover something new. \xa0Instead of writing a paper, you will actually apply your ideas in the real world and see them working. ', 'Quantitative Researcher', 'Research background devising novel approaches to solving problems and applying them to real world data to achieve robust, repeatable results. ', 'We’re using ideas across multiple disciplines: computer science, machine learning, statistics and biostatistics including survival analysis, supervised learning, natural language processing, imbalanced data, feature extraction and selection, and many, many other areas.', 'We combine quantitative research, software engineering and rigorous scientific investigation to build credit portfolios that produce strong and consistent yields across business cycles.\xa0\xa0 ', 'You must be comfortable writing code. \xa0Nobody will be doing it for you. \xa0The better you are at it, the more efficiently you can explore the model space and find winning ideas. ', 'You must be comfortable and enjoy working with data. \xa0This is the lifeblood of our business, your hypotheses start there and your testing ends there. ', ' ', 'You’ll investigate data, construct a hypothesis, and think deeply about the results. \xa0After several iterations, you will discover something new. \xa0Instead of writing a paper, you will actually apply your ideas in the real world and see them working. You’ll need to care more about analysis being correct then achieving a p-value below 0.05. You’ll collaborate with a group of colleagues with a variety of backgrounds in a process of scientific inquiry. By honestly and openly reviewing others’ work, and having your work reviewed by them, you’ll be a guardian of the research process at Theorem. We’re using ideas across multiple disciplines: computer science, machine learning, statistics and biostatistics including survival analysis, supervised learning, natural language processing, imbalanced data, feature extraction and selection, and many, many other areas.', 'What you bring to the table', 'What you’ll do']

['', ' Conduct data analysis to make business recommendations (cost-benefit, invest-divest, forecasting, impact analysis). Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs. Collaborate with cross-functional partners to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations. Develop a vision and roadmap for analytics across a product or functional group. Own relationships with executive stakeholders across Google Engineering. ', 'Experience with articulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to arrive at an answer.', 'About The Job', 'Work experience in an inter-disciplinary/cross-functional field.', "Master's degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Sciences).", 'Own relationships with executive stakeholders across Google Engineering.', 'Conduct data analysis to make business recommendations (cost-benefit, invest-divest, forecasting, impact analysis).', 'Preferred Qualifications', '8 years of relevant experience in an analytical function.', 'Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information. ['', 'You’ll investigate data, construct a hypothesis, and think deeply about the results. \xa0After several iterations, you will discover something new. \xa0Instead of writing a paper, you will actually apply your ideas in the real world and see them working. By honestly and openly reviewing others’ work, and having your work reviewed by them, you’ll be a guardian of the research process at our firm. ['', "We'd love to see:", "Machine Learning Engineer – EquitiesNew York, NY - USA\xa0For over 30 years, our clients have relied on our core product to access the data and analytics they need to make informed investment decisions. We absorb billions of data points from hundreds of financial markets every single day. Our teams build applications that fuel the markets by providing intelligent analytics and transparency to level the playing field. We share a real passion for solving today’s problems by innovating for tomorrow.\xa0We're building a new team, starting small, with researchers and engineers, whose goal is to leverage modern data science to enhance and extend our firm’s Equities suite of functionality. We will be working closely with product designers to understand how we could improve or optimize their products, including feature engineering, improved relevancy metrics, sentiment extraction, and more. We also intend to actively pursue research in the domain, publish papers, attend conferences, and represent the company in the industry.\xa0We leverage modern open source tools and will also work closely with an existing, dedicated team of infrastructure developers for big-data and distributed analytics. Our ultimate goals are new, novel applications of data science in the equity domain and making such analysis easy and quick for our clients.\xa0We'll trust you to: ", 'Actively pursue research in the job_title: Machine Learning Research Scientist - Pattern Recognition
job_text: ["You'll need to have: ", 'Strong computer science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures) ', "With the ever-increasing amount of data being generated, our clients need ever more sophisticated ways of extracting signal from noise. The Pattern Recognition team in the Machine Learning group is responsible for building a wide variety of analytics and recommendation systems to surface insights (e.g., identify market moving news stories, create new events that are relevant to users, provide personalized recommendations of events to users, etc.) to increase our client's productivity. ", 'Machine Learning Research Scientist - Pattern Recognition\xa0 ', ' Strong computer science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures)  A track record of relevant research  Solid background in machine learning and/or statistics, publication history  Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, CNTK, etc.) is helpful  Experience with NLP is also very useful', 'Big data experience ', "We'll trust you to:", "You'll need to have:", 'Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, CNTK, etc.) is helpful ', 'Familiarly with time series analytics ', 'Model evaluation ', ' Drive projects as the principle point-of-contact, with the ability to determine and elaborate on suitable metrics as well as methods  Write, test, and maintain production-quality code (mainly C++)  Publish papers and attend conferences in leading venues representing our Research  ', 'We are looking for research scientists with experience running a machine learning project from inception to completion, and specifically with a background and interest in one or more of the following areas: ', 'Write, test, and maintain production-quality code (mainly C++) ', 'We ingests more than 1.5 million news stories per day from more than 120,000 different sources to help our clients stay in the know. This data would be unmanageable without our help. News stories move markets. We build machines that understand them. ', 'A track record of relevant research ', 'State of the art deep learning (e.g., hyper-parameter tuning, sequence-to-sequence methods, word/entity embeddings, CNNs, etc.) ', 'Feature engineering ', 'Solid background in machine learning and/or statistics, publication history ', 'Experience with NLP is also very useful', 'Publish papers and attend conferences in leading venues representing our Research ', 'Drive projects as the principle point-of-contact, with the ability to determine and elaborate on suitable metrics as well as methods ', ' ', 'Machine Learning Research Scientist - Pattern Recognition\xa0', ' State of the art deep learning (e.g., hyper-parameter tuning, sequence-to-sequence methods, word/entity embeddings, CNNs, etc.)  Model evaluation  Feature engineering  Big data experience  Familiarly with time series analytics  ', "We'll trust you to: "]

['Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', '', 'What we’re looking for:', "What you'll do:", 'Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) ', "At our company, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our company is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Senior Data EngineerCommercial Launchpad helps push the Commercial Bank forward by incubating new ideas and accelerating strategic initiatives. We are a diverse, balanced and fearless team of designers, product managers, data scientists, engineers & strategists — working together to solve complex problems across the Commercial Bank. We move fast, we have the freedom to take risks, both in the ways we approach problems and the tools we use.Keep reading if:You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries, are comfortable with challenging the status-quo, and thrive in ambiguity.You LOVE technology and learning new things.What we’re looking for:Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.Demonstrated experience in the open source, big data ecosystem.What you'll do:As the data engineering technical lead within Launchpad, you’ll be working collaboratively with some of our brightest engineering talent to solve challenging, high impact business problems using data. You will be evaluating, installing, configuring, and deploying software; you will be writing code and use thoughtful engineering practices to test it, deploy it, and run it. We are a part of a larger organization, so we will rely on your ability to get things done through others.All of our infrastructure runs on AWS. Currently we use Airflow, PySpark, NiFi, Kafka, Flink for stream processing. We store data in Parquet and use databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redshift and Snowflake. We do analytics using H2O, Spark and MLlib, Databricks/EMR, TensorFlow. We build awesome products for our users that use this data. We write microservices in Go and Node.js, orchestrated by Kubernetes, with user experiences written in React and TypeScript. Your hands-on expertise in at least some of these tools will be valuable, as well as your track record of providing effective technical guidance.Basic QualificationsAt least 3 years of experience in software engineering inclusive of source control, agile practices, testing, CI/CD and design principlesAt least 3 years data engineering experience that includes Ingestion, Transformation, Storage, Query, or Analytics open source toolsPreferred Qualifications", 'Senior Data Engineer', ' ', 'Keep reading if:', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Basic Qualifications']
